title: 105_hr1381
content: REVOLVING FUND. The United States Institute for Environmental Conflict Resolution Revolving Fund is established in the Treasury, administered by the Foundation. The Fund is used for operating the Institute, including salaries, mediation services, and other necessary expenses. It is separate from the Trust Fund and not subject to certain program priorities. The Secretary of the Treasury invests portions of the Fund not needed for current expenses. The Secretary of the Treasury invests portions of the Revolving Fund in interest-bearing obligations of the United States, which can be acquired on original issue or by purchase of outstanding obligations at market price. Any obligations held in the Fund can be sold at market price, with interest and proceeds credited back to the Fund. The Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992 is amended to allow the use of the Institute by a federal agency. The Federal agency can utilize the Foundation and the Institute for assessment, mediation, or related services regarding environmental, public lands, or natural resource disputes. Payment for services can be made through a contract with funds going into the Revolving Fund. Prior notification to the chairperson of the President's Council on Environmental Quality is required before using the Foundation or Institute, including details of the issues and parties involved. The Federal agency must provide a written description of the issues, parties involved, prior efforts, and other relevant information in cases involving disputes between agencies before using the Foundation or Institute for services. The concurrence of the chairperson of the President's Council on Environmental Quality is required. SEC. 8. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Amends Section 13 of the Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992 to authorize appropriations to the Trust Fund and Revolving Fund for specified fiscal years. SEC. 9. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. SEC. 9. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Amends various sections of the Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992 to replace references to the "Fund" with "Trust Fund".
